responses.rationale: The segment reports a numerical metric '56 percent... were fatal' using standard descriptive language without vivid verbs or risk adjectives.
The segment reports a numerical metric 'one in five milk samples... had trace amounts' using standard descriptive language.
The segment reports numerical metrics 'at least one person' and '36 dairy herds' using standard descriptive language. 'Likely undercount' is a factual caveat.
The segment reports numerical metrics '22 million birds killed' and '13 million instead of 18 million' using standard descriptive language.
The segment reports numerical metrics '22 million birds killed' and '13 million instead of 18 million' using standard descriptive language.
The segment reports numerical metrics 'at least 26 states' and 'nearly a year' using standard descriptive language.
The segment reports numerical metrics like 'about 22 million birds' and specific counts for different bird types using standard descriptive language.
The segment reports numerical metrics 'about 13 million chickens and 305,000 turkeys' using standard descriptive language.
The segment reports a numerical metric '46 million chickens' using standard descriptive language.
The segment reports a numerical metric 'about 11.7 million turkeys annually' using standard descriptive language.
The segment reports factual locations of 'latest cases' using standard descriptive verbs, without vivid language or framing.
The segment reports a numerical metric '23 states' using standard descriptive language.
The segment describes the cause of disease spread, not prices, economic data, or numerical metrics.
